title: Umbra STAC Extension
description: STAC Extension for Umbra STAC Items .

oneOf.$comment: This is the schema for STAC Items.

allOf.$comment: Require fields here for Item Properties.

assets.$comment: This validates the fields in Item Assets, but does not require them.

oneOf.$comment: This is the schema for STAC Collections.

anyOf.$comment: This is the schema for the top-level fields in a Collection. Remove this if this extension does not define top-level fields for Collections.
This validates the fields in Collection Assets, but does not require them.
This is the schema for the fields in Item Asset Definitions. It doesn't require any fields.
This is the schema for the fields in Summaries. By default, only checks the existence of the properties, but not the schema of the summaries.

require_any_field.$comment: Please list all fields here so that we can force the existence of one of them in other parts of the schemas.

fields.$comment: Add your new fields here. Don't require them here, do that above in the corresponding schema.

umbra:best_resolution_azimuth_meters.description: The best possible azimuth resolution achievable from the CPHD data product processing.

umbra:best_resolution_range_meters.description: The best possible range resolution achievable from the CPHD data product processing.

umbra:collect_id.description: The collect id if the task is composed of a single collect for the task.

umbra:collect_ids.description: The collect ids if the task is composed of multiple collects for the task.

umbra:grazing_angle_degrees.description: The angle between the local vertical and the line of sight.

umbra:platform_pair.description: Transmitting platform name in the case of a Multistatic collect

umbra:slant_range_meters.description: The slant range is the straight line distance between the target location and the satellite in meters.

umbra:squint_angle_degrees_off_broadside.description: squint angle in degrees off broadside, where zero is directly broadside

umbra:squint_angle_engineering_degrees.description: squint angle engineering degrees. if negative on left side, if positive on right, 0 in direction of velocity.

umbra:squint_angle_exploitation_degrees.description: squint angle exploitation degrees. requires pairing with sat:observation_direction to know the meaning of the value. The least useful of the three squints.

umbra:target_azimuth_angle_degrees.description: The angle between the projected vector [the collection geometry of the particular opportunity] and a reference vector [north] on the reference plane is called the azimuth

^(?!umbra:).$comment: Above, change `umbra` to the prefix of this extension
